page.title: 01Padnal & Prickwillow
page.content: The D Block lies half way between Littleport in the North and Ely to the South. Part of it covers{Padnal}which comes from old English and means place of the frog. In the extreme right-hand corner block, lies Prickwillow which has a population of some{four hundred {people.}It is one of the lowest places in England, some land being two feet below the River. This has made the drainage of the waterfilled Peat difficult and has only been accomplished by the re-routing of the River by what's known as the{New Cut.} Several wind pumps had kept the land relatively dry, but when the River no longer went to Prickwillow, a drain was dug and a series of modern diesel /electric pumps were installed by the Bridge at Prickwillow to pump out at Cross Cut (River Lark). Farmers say Peat shrinks height of man,in his life
